postcontent:
This is for a vintage Smith & Wesson B44 62 Leather Pancake Style Holster. The markings on this holster are B44 62. I had to do a lot of research on the internet to figure out what exactly this thing was made for and the B44 represents that it is a black holster model 44 which is the pancake style with a thumb break retention strap. The 62 means that it was designed to fit a “J” frame revolver with a 2 inch barrel. It is in incredibly good shape and the leather not dried out at all and is very malleable. It does not look like it was used very much and just sat in his safe for years. I was a bit surprised at the quality of the construction and how clean the edges are. It looks to be very well made and of good grade of leather and kind of reminds me of the old school detective holsters where they carried small snubbie revolvers. I seriously can’t figure out why he might have had this unless it was a gun he had and sold before I got into guns with him. Since it seems to have no relation to anything he had or left us I feel comfortable selling it to someone who will appreciate it. During my research I found that these holsters were made in the 70’s and 80’s in a Smith & Wesson plant here in North Carolina. They have since moved to another factory but below is the explanation on the holster design:

--- The first two numbers are the model holster, in this case a #44 Pancake. The second two numbers are the frame size and barrel length. 62 is 2" J frames, Charter Arms Undercover, Wesson 11 - 15 or any of the small H&R's. Most of the 62 codes will also take a Detective Special. A "B" in front of the numbers means black as opposed to russet. A "W" following the numbers means basket weave and a "C" means flower carved.--- 

I tried to research a lot of the auction sites to figure out a price for this and it was very difficult. If I were to compare it to a modern holster, the workmanship and style remind me of a Gould and Goodrich or Bianchi.  The only holsters I could find were going anywhere from $30 to $150. I’m sure there is something special about the higher priced ones that I just don’t know but I don’t see anything that rare about this one other than the cool factor. I am asking $25 for the holster.
